summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons internal memorandum and budget request from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 17, 2019, seeking $100,000 to hire a contractor for asbestos removal. The document details the cost estimate and justification, citing multiple surveys from 2009 onward that identified asbestos in inmate and visitor areas. It is a routine facilities management document unrelated to the Epstein case narrative.

keyFacts: The Metropolitan Correctional Center New York identified multiple areas containing asbestos through surveys dating from 2009 to 2019.
The asbestos was described as 'unintentionally breaking and separating from the floor in both inmate and visitor areas.'
The institution requested $100,000 to hire a contractor to inspect, clean, abate, and dispose of all identified asbestos.
The document is a routine facilities management request and contains no direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or related individuals.
